str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.
Of Latin origin but uncertain significance; Titus, a Christian.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From ana and pauo; to repose (be exempt), remain); by implication, to refresh.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
